items.title: [VIOLENCE] Risk & Actions
items.worker_notes:
Violence risk management actions.

⚠️ Copy with placeholders — edit fields in [SQUARE BRACKETS] before saving.
items.text:
VIOLENCE – [CLIENT] has a history of violent behaviour.

ACTIONS:

Staff Safety – Staff should report to HB Officers which client they have come to see and which designated/appropriate room contact will be taking place.

Staff Safety – Staff should sit near the green alarm button or nearest room exit during contact.

Safety – Staff to ensure appropriate safety procedures are followed prior to attending the appointment, in line with local procedures.

Continuity of Care – Staff to ensure this risk is shared with the Community Treatment Provider as part of continuity of care at the release stage.

DART Staff Team – Worker to inform and update staff of potential risks via the daily flash meeting.

items.title: [GANG] Risk & Actions
items.worker_notes: Gang-related behaviour actions (IR/Security and team comms).
items.text:
GANG RELATED BEHAVIOUR

Security – Complete an IR and submit to Security. Advise House Block Officers of any disclosed or observed behaviour which may pose a risk to others on the wing, within the prison, or in the community.

DART Staff Team – Worker to inform and update staff of potential risks via the daily flash meeting.

RISK TO FEMALES

Staff Safety – Female staff to conclude face-to-face contact if they feel vulnerable or threatened in any way.

Staff Safety – Female worker to inform wing Officers of any inappropriate behaviour or language demonstrated by [CLIENT].

Safety – IR to be submitted and wing Officers informed of any inappropriate behaviour or language.

items.title: [SUBSTANCE] Illicit Drug Use – Support Plan
items.worker_notes:
Use where client reports no current use but a plan is documented for lapse/relapse.

⚠️ Copy with placeholders — edit fields in [SQUARE BRACKETS] before saving.
items.text:
ILLICIT DRUG USE

[CLIENT] reports not currently using illicit drugs; however, a plan is in place should lapse or relapse occur.

ACTIONS:

Support – [CLIENT] advised to contact DART via the kiosk or by asking Officers on the House Block if tempted to use or requiring additional support.

Harm Reduction – DART worker to reiterate harm reduction advice and provide written information.

Support Plan – DART worker and [CLIENT] to formulate a support plan going forward. Referral to Clinical DART to be completed if required.

Prescribing – Referral to Clinical DART for substitute prescribing or script review where appropriate.

Clinical DART – Clinical team to be informed of any illicit use alongside prescribed medication.

DART Staff Team – Worker to update staff via the daily flash meeting.

Random Drug Testing – [CLIENT] to provide urine samples as requested under the Gateway Programme Compact.

items.text:
SELF HARM

Client Safety – Recovery Coordinator to open an ACCT if [CLIENT] reports thoughts of self-harm or suicide.

Communication – Personal Officer or Senior Officer on the wing to be informed.

Joint Working – Referral to Mental Health Team.

Plan – Daily contact to be made with [CLIENT] for [DURATION] to provide additional support.

Joint Working – Attendance at ACCT reviews as scheduled.

Safeguarding – Safeguarding referral to be recorded.

Monitoring – Daily operational reports to be checked.

DART Staff Team – Worker to update staff via the daily flash meeting until ACCT closed.

CASU / SECRETED ITEMS

[CLIENT] located in the [UNIT] under the Secreted Items Policy. Presentation included [OBSERVATIONS]. [CLIENT] denied illicit substance use or having items secreted.

ACTIONS:
